groups.description: The groups associated to the user

items.description: The roles assigned to own user

username.description: The username associated with the provided key

roles.description: The role names associated to the user

userId.description: The user id of the given user

active.description: activity status of the returned user

createdAt.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

apiKeyFirstLetters.description: First 3 letters of the associated API-key

lastUsedAt.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ)

collection.description: string or regex. if a specific collection name, if left empty it will be ALL or *
string or regex. if a specific collection name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

tenant.description: string or regex. if a specific tenant name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

object.description: string or regex. if a specific object ID, if left empty it will be ALL or *

verbosity.description: whether to allow (verbose) returning shards and stats data in the response

collection.description: string or regex. if a specific collection name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

users.description: string or regex. if a specific name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

collection.description: string or regex. if a specific collection name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

tenant.description: string or regex. if a specific tenant name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

role.description: string or regex. if a specific role name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

scope.description: set the scope for the manage role permission

collections.description: resources applicable for collection and/or tenant actions

collection.description: string or regex. if a specific collection name, if left empty it will be ALL or *
string or regex. if a specific collection name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

shard.description: string or regex. if a specific shard name, if left empty it will be ALL or *

rel.description: relationship if both resources are related, e.g. 'next', 'previous', 'parent', etc.

name.description: human readable name of the resource group

documentationHref.description: weaviate documentation about this resource group

username.description: The username that was extracted either from the authentication information

C11yWordsResponse.description: An array of available words and contexts.

individualWords.description: Weighted results for per individual word

C11yExtension.description: A resource describing an extension to the contextinoary, containing both the identifier and the definition of the extension

concept.description: The new concept you want to extend. Must be an all-lowercase single word, or a space delimited compound word. Examples: 'foobarium', 'my custom concept'

definition.description: A list of space-delimited words or a sentence describing what the custom concept is about. Avoid using the custom concept itself. An Example definition for the custom concept 'foobarium': would be 'a naturally occurring element which can only be seen by programmers'

weight.description: Weight of the definition of the new concept where 1='override existing definition entirely' and 0='ignore custom definition'. Note that if the custom concept is not present in the contextionary yet, the weight cannot be less than 1.

C11yNearestNeighbors.description: C11y function to show the nearest neighbors to a word.

C11yVector.description: A vector representation of the object in the Contextionary. If provided at object creation, this wil take precedence over any vectorizer setting.

Vector.description: A vector representation of the object. If provided at object creation, this wil take precedence over any vectorizer setting.

Vectors.description: A map of named vectors for multi-vector representations.

C11yVectorBasedQuestion.description: Receive question based on array of classes, properties and values.

id.description: The id that uniquely identifies this particular deprecations (mostly used internally)

status.description: Whether the problematic API functionality is deprecated (planned to be removed) or already removed

apiType.description: Describes which API is effected, usually one of: REST, GraphQL

mitigation.description: User-required object to not be affected by the (planned) removal

sinceVersion.description: The deprecation was introduced in this version

plannedRemovalVersion.description: A best-effort guess of which upcoming version will remove the feature entirely

removedIn.description: If the feature has already been removed, it was removed in this version

removedTime.description: If the feature has already been removed, it was removed at this timestamp

sinceTime.description: The deprecation was introduced in this version

locations.description: The locations within the specified API affected by this deprecation

ErrorResponse.description: An error response given by Weaviate end-points.

GraphQLError.description: An error response caused by a GraphQL query.

operationName.description: The name of the operation if multiple exist in the query.

InvertedIndexConfig.description: Configure the inverted index built into Weaviate (default: 60).

cleanupIntervalSeconds.description: Asynchronous index clean up happens every n seconds

indexTimestamps.description: Index each object by its internal timestamps (default: 'false').

indexNullState.description: Index each object with the null state (default: 'false').

usingBlockMaxWAND.description: Using BlockMax WAND for query execution (default: 'false', will be 'true' for new collections created after 1.30).

ReplicationConfig.description: Configure how replication is executed in a cluster

factor.description: Number of times a class is replicated (default: 1).

deletionStrategy.description: Conflict resolution strategy for deleted objects.

BM25Config.description: tuning parameters for the BM25 algorithm

k1.description: Calibrates term-weight scaling based on the term frequency within a document (default: 1.2).

b.description: Calibrates term-weight scaling based on the document length (default: 0.75).

StopwordConfig.description: fine-grained control over stopword list usage

preset.description: Pre-existing list of common words by language (default: 'en'). Options: ['en', 'none'].

additions.description: Stopwords to be considered additionally (default: []). Can be any array of custom strings.

removals.description: Stopwords to be removed from consideration (default: []). Can be any array of custom strings.

MultiTenancyConfig.description: Configuration related to multi-tenancy within a class

enabled.description: Whether or not multi-tenancy is enabled for this class (default: false).

autoTenantCreation.description: Nonexistent tenants should (not) be created implicitly (default: false).

autoTenantActivation.description: Existing tenants should (not) be turned HOT implicitly when they are accessed and in another activity status (default: false).

Meta.description: Contains meta information of the current Weaviate instance.

grpcMaxMessageSize.description: Max message size for GRPC connection in bytes.

MultipleRef.description: Multiple instances of references to other objects.

PatchDocumentObject.description: Either a JSONPatch document as defined by RFC 6902 (from, op, path, value), or a merge document (RFC 7396).

from.description: A string containing a JSON Pointer value.

value.description: The value to be used within the operations.

PatchDocumentAction.description: Either a JSONPatch document as defined by RFC 6902 (from, op, path, value), or a merge document (RFC 7396).

from.description: A string containing a JSON Pointer value.

value.description: The value to be used within the operations.

ReplicationReplicateReplicaRequest.description: Specifies the parameters required to initiate a shard replica movement operation between two nodes for a given collection and shard. This request defines the source and destination node, the collection and type of transfer.

sourceNodeName.description: The name of the Weaviate node currently hosting the shard replica that needs to be moved or copied.

destinationNodeName.description: The name of the Weaviate node where the new shard replica will be created as part of the movement or copy operation.

collectionId.description: The unique identifier (name) of the collection to which the target shard belongs.

shardId.description: The ID of the shard whose replica is to be moved or copied.

transferType.description: Specifies the type of replication operation to perform. 'COPY' creates a new replica on the destination node while keeping the source replica. 'MOVE' creates a new replica on the destination node and then removes the source replica upon successful completion. Defaults to 'COPY' if omitted.

ReplicationReplicateReplicaResponse.description: Contains the unique identifier for a successfully initiated asynchronous replica movement operation. This ID can be used to track the progress of the operation.

id.description: The unique identifier (ID) assigned to the registered replication operation.

ReplicationShardingStateResponse.description: Provides the detailed sharding state for one or more collections, including the distribution of shards and their replicas across the cluster nodes.

ReplicationDisableReplicaRequest.description: Specifies the parameters required to mark a specific shard replica as inactive (soft-delete) on a particular node. This action typically prevents the replica from serving requests but does not immediately remove its data.

nodeName.description: The name of the Weaviate node hosting the shard replica that is to be disabled.

collectionId.description: The name of the collection to which the shard replica belongs.

shardId.description: The ID of the shard whose replica is to be disabled.

ReplicationDeleteReplicaRequest.description: Specifies the parameters required to permanently delete a specific shard replica from a particular node. This action will remove the replica's data from the node.

nodeName.description: The name of the Weaviate node from which the shard replica will be deleted.

collectionId.description: The name of the collection to which the shard replica belongs.

shardId.description: The ID of the shard whose replica is to be deleted.

ReplicationShardReplicas.description: Represents a shard and lists the nodes that currently host its replicas.

ReplicationShardingState.description: Details the sharding layout for a specific collection, mapping each shard to its set of replicas across the cluster.

shards.description: An array detailing each shard within the collection and the nodes hosting its replicas.

ReplicationReplicateDetailsReplicaStatus.description: Represents the current or historical status of a shard replica involved in a replication operation, including its operational state and any associated errors.

state.description: The current operational state of the replica during the replication process.

errors.description: A list of error messages encountered by this replica during the replication operation, if any.

ReplicationReplicateDetailsReplicaRespon.description: Provides a comprehensive overview of a specific replication operation, detailing its unique ID, the involved collection, shard, source and target nodes, transfer type, current status, and optionally, its status history.

id.description: The unique identifier (ID) of this specific replication operation.

shardId.description: The identifier of the shard involved in this replication operation.

collection.description: The name of the collection to which the shard being replicated belongs.

sourceNodeId.description: The identifier of the node from which the replica is being moved or copied (the source node).

targetNodeId.description: The identifier of the node to which the replica is being moved or copied (the destination node).

transferType.description: Indicates whether the operation is a 'COPY' (source replica remains) or a 'MOVE' (source replica is removed after successful transfer).

status.description: An object detailing the current operational state of the replica movement and any errors encountered.

statusHistory.description: An array detailing the historical sequence of statuses the replication operation has transitioned through, if requested and available.

PeerUpdate.description: A single peer in the network.

id.description: The session ID of the peer.

uri.description: The location where the peer is exposed to the internet.

schemaHash.description: The latest known hash of the peer's schema.

VectorWeights.description: Allow custom overrides of vector weights as math expressions. E.g. "pancake": "7" will set the weight for the word pancake to 7 in the vectorization, whereas "w * 3" would triple the originally calculated word. This is an open object, with OpenAPI Specification 3.0 this will be more detailed. See Weaviate docs for more info. In the future this will become a key/value (string/string) object.

PropertySchema.description: Names and values of an individual property. A returned response may also contain additional metadata, such as from classification or feature projection.

SchemaHistory.description: This is an open object, with OpenAPI Specification 3.0 this will be more detailed. See Weaviate docs for more info. In the future this will become a key/value OR a SingleRef definition.

SchemaClusterStatus.description: Indicates the health of the schema in a cluster.

healthy.description: True if the cluster is in sync, false if there is an issue (see error).

error.description: Contains the sync check error if one occurred

hostname.description: Hostname of the coordinating node, i.e. the one that received the cluster. This can be useful information if the error message contains phrases such as 'other nodes agree, but local does not', etc.

nodeCount.description: Number of nodes that participated in the sync check

ignoreSchemaSync.description: The cluster check at startup can be ignored (to recover from an out-of-sync situation).

class.description: Name of the class (a.k.a. 'collection') (required). Multiple words should be concatenated in CamelCase, e.g. `ArticleAuthor`.

vectorConfig.description: Configure named vectors. Either use this field or `vectorizer`, `vectorIndexType`, and `vectorIndexConfig` fields. Available from `v1.24.0`.

vectorIndexType.description: Name of the vector index to use, eg. (HNSW)

vectorIndexConfig.description: Vector-index config, that is specific to the type of index selected in vectorIndexType

shardingConfig.description: Manage how the index should be sharded and distributed in the cluster

vectorizer.description: Specify how the vectors for this class should be determined. The options are either 'none' - this means you have to import a vector with each object yourself - or the name of a module that provides vectorization capabilities, such as 'text2vec-contextionary'. If left empty, it will use the globally configured default which can itself either be 'none' or a specific module.

moduleConfig.description: Configuration specific to modules in a collection context.

description.description: Description of the collection for metadata purposes.

dataType.description: Data type of the property (required). If it starts with a capital (for example Person), may be a reference to another type.

moduleConfig.description: Configuration specific to modules this Weaviate instance has installed

name.description: The name of the property (required). Multiple words should be concatenated in camelCase, e.g. `nameOfAuthor`.

indexInverted.description:
(Deprecated). Whether to include this property in the inverted index. If `false`, this property cannot be used in `where` filters, `bm25` or `hybrid` search.

Unrelated to vectorization behavior (deprecated as of v1.19; use indexFilterable or/and indexSearchable instead)

indexFilterable.description:
Whether to include this property in the filterable, Roaring Bitmap index. If `false`, this property cannot be used in `where` filters.

Note: Unrelated to vectorization behavior.

indexSearchable.description: Optional. Should this property be indexed in the inverted index. Defaults to true. Applicable only to properties of data type text and text[]. If you choose false, you will not be able to use this property in bm25 or hybrid search. This property has no affect on vectorization decisions done by modules

indexRangeFilters.description: Whether to include this property in the filterable, range-based Roaring Bitmap index. Provides better performance for range queries compared to filterable index in large datasets. Applicable only to properties of data type int, number, date.

tokenization.description: Determines tokenization of the property as separate words or whole field. Optional. Applies to text and text[] data types. Allowed values are `word` (default; splits on any non-alphanumerical, lowercases), `lowercase` (splits on white spaces, lowercases), `whitespace` (splits on white spaces), `field` (trims). Not supported for remaining data types

nestedProperties.description: The properties of the nested object(s). Applies to object and object[] data types.

vectorizer.description: Configuration of a specific vectorizer used by this vector

vectorIndexType.description: Name of the vector index to use, eg. (HNSW)

vectorIndexConfig.description: Vector-index config, that is specific to the type of index selected in vectorIndexType

nestedProperties.description: The properties of the nested object(s). Applies to object and object[] data types.

ShardStatusList.description: The status of all the shards of a Class

ShardStatusGetResponse.description: Response body of shard status get request

vectorQueueSize.description: Size of the vector queue of the shard

ShardStatus.description: The status of a single shard

BackupCreateStatusResponse.description: The definition of a backup create metadata

id.description: The ID of the backup. Must be URL-safe and work as a filesystem path, only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed.

backend.description: Backup backend name e.g. filesystem, gcs, s3.

path.description: destination path of backup files proper to selected backend

BackupRestoreStatusResponse.description: The definition of a backup restore metadata.

id.description: The ID of the backup. Must be URL-safe and work as a filesystem path, only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed.

backend.description: Backup backend name e.g. filesystem, gcs, s3.

path.description: Destination path of backup files proper to selected backup backend, contains bucket and path.

error.description: Error message if backup restoration failed.

Endpoint.description: Name of the endpoint, e.g. s3.amazonaws.com.

Bucket.description: Name of the bucket, container, volume, etc.

Path.description: Path or key within the bucket.

CPUPercentage.description: Desired CPU core utilization ranging from 1%-80%

ChunkSize.description: Aimed chunk size, with a minimum of 2MB, default of 128MB, and a maximum of 512MB. The actual chunk size may vary.

CompressionLevel.description: compression level used by compression algorithm

Endpoint.description: name of the endpoint, e.g. s3.amazonaws.com

Bucket.description: Name of the bucket, container, volume, etc

CPUPercentage.description: Desired CPU core utilization ranging from 1%-80%

BackupCreateRequest.description: Request body for creating a backup of a set of classes

id.description: The ID of the backup (required). Must be URL-safe and work as a filesystem path, only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed.

config.description: Custom configuration for the backup creation process

include.description: List of collections to include in the backup creation process. If not set, all collections are included. Cannot be used together with `exclude`.

exclude.description: List of collections to exclude from the backup creation process. If not set, all collections are included. Cannot be used together with `include`.

BackupCreateResponse.description: The definition of a backup create response body

id.description: The ID of the backup. Must be URL-safe and work as a filesystem path, only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed.

classes.description: The list of classes for which the backup creation process was started

backend.description: Backup backend name e.g. filesystem, gcs, s3.

bucket.description: Name of the bucket, container, volume, etc

BackupListResponse.description: The definition of a backup create response body

id.description: The ID of the backup. Must be URL-safe and work as a filesystem path, only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed.

path.description: destination path of backup files proper to selected backend

classes.description: The list of classes for which the existed backup process

BackupRestoreRequest.description: Request body for restoring a backup for a set of collections (classes).

config.description: Custom configuration for the backup restoration process.

include.description: List of collections (classes) to include in the backup restoration process.

exclude.description: List of collections (classes) to exclude from the backup restoration process.

node_mapping.description: Allows overriding the node names stored in the backup with different ones. Useful when restoring backups to a different environment.

BackupRestoreResponse.description: The definition of a backup restore response body.

id.description: The ID of the backup. Must be URL-safe and work as a filesystem path, only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed.

classes.description: The list of collections (classes) for which the backup restoration process was started.

backend.description: Backup backend name e.g. filesystem, gcs, s3.

path.description: Destination path of backup files proper to selected backend.

error.description: Error message if backup restoration failed.

shardCount.description: The count of Weaviate's shards. To see this value, set `output` to `verbose`.

objectCount.description: The total number of objects in DB.

BatchStats.description: The summary of a nodes batch queue congestion status.

queueLength.description: How many objects are currently in the batch queue.

ratePerSecond.description: How many objects are approximately processed from the batch queue per second.

NodeShardStatus.description: The definition of a node shard status response body

objectCount.description: The number of objects in shard.

vectorIndexingStatus.description: The status of the vector indexing process.

vectorQueueLength.description: The length of the vector indexing queue.

loaded.description: The load status of the shard.

asyncReplicationStatus.description: The status of the async replication.

numberOfReplicas.description: Number of replicas for the shard.

replicationFactor.description: Minimum number of replicas for the shard.

AsyncReplicationStatus.description: The status of the async replication.

objectsPropagated.description: The number of objects propagated in the most recent iteration.

startDiffTimeUnixMillis.description: The start time of the most recent iteration.

targetNode.description: The target node of the replication, if set, otherwise empty.

NodeStatus.description: The definition of a backup node status response body

shards.description: The list of the shards with it's statistics.

NodesStatusResponse.description: The status of all of the Weaviate nodes

startedAt.description: The time when the task was created.

finishedAt.description: The time when the task was finished.

finishedNodes.description: The nodes that finished the task.

error.description: The high level reason why the task failed.

ClusterStatisticsResponse.description: The cluster statistics of all of the Weaviate nodes

SingleRef.description: Either set beacon (direct reference) or set class and schema (concept reference)

class.description: If using a concept reference (rather than a direct reference), specify the desired class name here

schema.description: If using a concept reference (rather than a direct reference), specify the desired properties here

beacon.description: If using a direct reference, specify the URI to point to the cross-ref here. Should be in the form of weaviate://localhost/<uuid> for the example of a local cross-ref to an object

href.description: If using a direct reference, this read-only fields provides a link to the referenced resource. If 'origin' is globally configured, an absolute URI is shown - a relative URI otherwise.

classification.description: Additional Meta information about classifications if the item was part of one

AdditionalProperties.description: (Response only) Additional meta information about a single object.

ReferenceMetaClassification.description: This meta field contains additional info about the classified reference property

overallCount.description: overall neighbors checked as part of the classification. In most cases this will equal k, but could be lower than k - for example if not enough data was present

winningCount.description: size of the winning group, a number between 1..k

losingCount.description: size of the losing group, can be 0 if the winning group size equals k

closestOverallDistance.description: The lowest distance of any neighbor, regardless of whether they were in the winning or losing group

winningDistance.description: deprecated - do not use, to be removed in 0.23.0

meanWinningDistance.description: Mean distance of all neighbors from the winning group

closestWinningDistance.description: Closest distance of a neighbor from the winning group

closestLosingDistance.description: The lowest distance of a neighbor in the losing group. Optional. If k equals the size of the winning group, there is no losing group

losingDistance.description: deprecated - do not use, to be removed in 0.23.0

meanLosingDistance.description: Mean distance of all neighbors from the losing group. Optional. If k equals the size of the winning group, there is no losing group.

from.description: Long-form beacon-style URI to identify the source of the cross-ref including the property name. Should be in the form of weaviate://localhost/<kinds>/<uuid>/<className>/<propertyName>, where <kinds> must be one of 'objects', 'objects' and <className> and <propertyName> must represent the cross-ref property of source class to be used.

to.description: Short-form URI to point to the cross-ref. Should be in the form of weaviate://localhost/<uuid> for the example of a local cross-ref to an object

latitude.description: The latitude of the point on earth in decimal form

longitude.description: The longitude of the point on earth in decimal form

input.description: The raw input as the phone number is present in your raw data set. It will be parsed into the standardized formats if valid.

internationalFormatted.description: Read-only. Parsed result in the international format (e.g. +49 123 ...)

defaultCountry.description: Optional. The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. This is used to figure out the correct countryCode and international format if only a national number (e.g. 0123 4567) is provided

national.description: Read-only. The numerical representation of the national part

nationalFormatted.description: Read-only. Parsed result in the national format (e.g. 0123 456789)

valid.description: Read-only. Indicates whether the parsed number is a valid phone number

class.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.

creationTimeUnix.description: (Response only) Timestamp of creation of this object in milliseconds since epoch UTC.

lastUpdateTimeUnix.description: (Response only) Timestamp of the last object update in milliseconds since epoch UTC.

vector.description: This field returns vectors associated with the object. C11yVector, Vector or Vectors values are possible.

vectors.description: This field returns vectors associated with the object.

tenant.description: The name of the tenant the object belongs to.

match.description: Outlines how to find the objects to be deleted.

class.description: The name of the collection (class) from which to delete objects.

where.description: Filter to limit the objects to be deleted.

output.description: Controls the verbosity of the output, possible values are: "minimal", "verbose". Defaults to "minimal".

deletionTimeUnixMilli.description: Timestamp of deletion in milliseconds since epoch UTC.

dryRun.description:
If true, the call will show which objects would be matched using the specified filter without deleting any objects.

Depending on the configured verbosity, you will either receive a count of affected objects, or a list of IDs.

match.description: Outlines how to find the objects to be deleted.

class.description: The name of the collection (class) from which to delete objects.

where.description: Filter to limit the objects to be deleted.

output.description: Controls the verbosity of the output, possible values are: "minimal", "verbose". Defaults to "minimal".

deletionTimeUnixMilli.description: Timestamp of deletion in milliseconds since epoch UTC.

dryRun.description: If true, objects will not be deleted yet, but merely listed. Defaults to false.

matches.description: How many objects were matched by the filter.

limit.description: The most amount of objects that can be deleted in a single query, equals QUERY_MAXIMUM_RESULTS.

successful.description: How many objects were successfully deleted in this round.

failed.description: How many objects should have been deleted but could not be deleted.

objects.description: With output set to "minimal" only objects with error occurred will the be described. Successfully deleted objects would be omitted. Output set to "verbose" will list all of the objets with their respective statuses.

totalResults.description: The total number of objects for the query. The number of items in a response may be smaller due to paging.

Classification.description: Manage classifications, trigger them and view status of past classifications.

id.description: ID to uniquely identify this classification run.

class.description: The name of the collection (class) which is used in this classification.

classifyProperties.description: Which ref-property to set as part of the classification.

basedOnProperties.description: Base the text-based classification on these fields (of type text).

meta.description: Additional meta information about the classification.

type.description: Which algorithm to use for classifications.

sourceWhere.description: Limit the objects to be classified.

trainingSetWhere.description: Limit the training objects to be considered during the classification. Can only be used on types with explicit training sets, such as 'knn'.

targetWhere.description: Limit the possible sources when using an algorithm which doesn't really on training data, e.g. 'contextual'. When using an algorithm with a training set, such as 'knn', limit the training set instead.

ClassificationMeta.description: Additional information to a specific classification.

started.description: Time when this classification was started.

count.description: Number of objects which were taken into consideration for classification.

countFailed.description: Number of objects which could not be classified - see error message for details.

WhereFilter.description: Filter search results using a where filter.

operands.description: Combine multiple where filters, requires 'And' or 'Or' operator.

path.description: Path to the property currently being filtered.

valueString.description: value as text (deprecated as of v1.19; alias for valueText)

valueStringArray.description: value as text (deprecated as of v1.19; alias for valueText)

valueGeoRange.description: value as geo coordinates and distance

WhereFilterGeoRange.description: Filter within a distance of a georange.

Tenant.description: Attributes representing a single tenant within Weaviate.

activityStatus.description: Activity status of the tenant's shard. Optional for creating tenant (implicit `ACTIVE`) and required for updating tenant. For creation, allowed values are `ACTIVE` - tenant is fully active and `INACTIVE` - tenant is inactive; no actions can be performed on tenant, tenant's files are stored locally. For updating, `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE` and also `OFFLOADED` - as INACTIVE, but files are stored on cloud storage. The following values are read-only and are set by the server for internal use: `OFFLOADING` - tenant is transitioning from ACTIVE/INACTIVE to OFFLOADED, `ONLOADING` - tenant is transitioning from OFFLOADED to ACTIVE/INACTIVE. We still accept deprecated names `HOT` (now `ACTIVE`), `COLD` (now `INACTIVE`), `FROZEN` (now `OFFLOADED`), `FREEZING` (now `OFFLOADING`), `UNFREEZING` (now `ONLOADING`).

info.description:
# Introduction
 Weaviate is an open source, AI-native vector database that helps developers create intuitive and reliable AI-powered applications. 
 ### Base Path 
The base path for the Weaviate server is structured as `[YOUR-WEAVIATE-HOST]:[PORT]/v1`. As an example, if you wish to access the `schema` endpoint on a local instance, you would navigate to `http://localhost:8080/v1/schema`. Ensure you replace `[YOUR-WEAVIATE-HOST]` and `[PORT]` with your actual server host and port number respectively. 
 ### Questions? 
If you have any comments or questions, please feel free to reach out to us at the community forum [https://forum.weaviate.io/](https://forum.weaviate.io/). 
### Issues? 
If you find a bug or want to file a feature request, please open an issue on our GitHub repository for [Weaviate](https://github.com/weaviate/weaviate). 
### Want more documentation? 
For a quickstart, code examples, concepts and more, please visit our [documentation page](https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate).
info.title: Weaviate

CommonAfterParameterQuery.description:
A threshold UUID of the objects to retrieve after, using an UUID-based ordering. This object is not part of the set.

Must be used with `class`, typically in conjunction with `limit`.

Note `after` cannot be used with `offset` or `sort`.

For a null value similar to offset=0, set an empty string in the request, i.e. `after=` or `after`.
CommonAfterParameterQuery.name: after

CommonOffsetParameterQuery.description:
The starting index of the result window. Note `offset` will retrieve `offset+limit` results and return `limit` results from the object with index `offset` onwards. Limited by the value of `QUERY_MAXIMUM_RESULTS`.

Should be used in conjunction with `limit`.

Cannot be used with `after`.
CommonOffsetParameterQuery.name: offset

CommonLimitParameterQuery.description: The maximum number of items to be returned per page. The default is 25 unless set otherwise as an environment variable.
CommonLimitParameterQuery.name: limit

CommonIncludeParameterQuery.description: Include additional information, such as classification information. Allowed values include: `classification`, `vector` and `interpretation`.
CommonIncludeParameterQuery.name: include

CommonConsistencyLevelParameterQuery.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.
CommonConsistencyLevelParameterQuery.name: consistency_level

CommonTenantParameterQuery.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant class.
CommonTenantParameterQuery.name: tenant

CommonNodeNameParameterQuery.description: The target node which should fulfill the request.
CommonNodeNameParameterQuery.name: node_name

CommonSortParameterQuery.description: Name(s) of the property to sort by - e.g. `city`, or `country,city`.
CommonSortParameterQuery.name: sort

CommonOrderParameterQuery.description: Order parameter to tell how to order (asc or desc) data within given field. Should be used in conjunction with `sort` parameter. If providing multiple `sort` values, provide multiple `order` values in corresponding order, e.g.: `sort=author_name,title&order=desc,asc`.
CommonOrderParameterQuery.name: order

CommonClassParameterQuery.description:
The collection from which to query objects.

Note that if `class` is not provided, the response will not include any objects.
CommonClassParameterQuery.name: class

CommonOutputVerbosityParameterQuery.description: Controls the verbosity of the output, possible values are: "minimal", "verbose". Defaults to "minimal".
CommonOutputVerbosityParameterQuery.name: output

get.description: Get links to other endpoints to help discover the REST API.
Indicates if the Weaviate instance is running and responsive to basic HTTP requests. Primarily used for health checks, such as Kubernetes liveness probes.

200.description: The application is alive and responding to HTTP requests.

get.description: Indicates if the Weaviate instance has completed its startup routines and is prepared to accept user traffic (data import, queries, etc.). Used for readiness checks, such as Kubernetes readiness probes.

200.description: The application is ready to serve traffic.

503.description: The application is not ready to serve traffic. Traffic should be directed to other available replicas if applicable.

get.description: Provides OpenID Connect (OIDC) discovery information if OIDC authentication is configured for Weaviate. Returns details like the token issuer URL, client ID, and required scopes.

href.description: The OIDC issuer URL to redirect to for authentication.

clientId.description: The OAuth Client ID configured for Weaviate.

scopes.description: The required OAuth scopes for authentication.

404.description: OIDC provider is not configured for this Weaviate instance.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while retrieving OIDC configuration. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description: Begins an asynchronous operation to move or copy a specific shard replica from its current node to a designated target node. The operation involves copying data, synchronizing, and potentially decommissioning the source replica.

200.description: Replication operation registered successfully. ID of the operation is returned.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

delete.summary: Schedules all replication operations for deletion across all collections, shards, and nodes.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

get.description: Fetches the current status and detailed information for a specific replication operation, identified by its unique ID. Optionally includes historical data of the operation's progress if requested.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the replication operation to get details for.

parameters.name: includeHistory
parameters.description: Whether to include the history of the replication operation.

200.description: The details of the replication operation.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

delete.description: Removes a specific replication operation. If the operation is currently active, it will be cancelled and its resources cleaned up before the operation is deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the replication operation to delete.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

get.description: Retrieves a list of currently registered replication operations, optionally filtered by collection, shard, or node ID.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: The ID of the target node to get details for.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The name of the collection to get details for.

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: The shard to get details for.

parameters.name: includeHistory
parameters.description: Whether to include the history of the replication operation.

200.description: The details of the replication operations.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

post.description: Requests the cancellation of an active replication operation identified by its ID. The operation will be stopped, but its record will remain in the 'CANCELLED' state (can't be resumed) and will not be automatically deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the replication operation to cancel.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

get.description: Fetches the current sharding state, including replica locations and statuses, for all collections or a specified collection. If a shard name is provided along with a collection, the state for that specific shard is returned.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: The collection name to get the sharding state for.

parameters.name: shard
parameters.description: The shard to get the sharding state for.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

get.description: Retrieves a list of data objects. By default, objects are returned in reverse order of creation. Requires a `class` parameter to specify which collection's objects to list, otherwise, returns an empty list.

200.description: Successful response containing the list of objects. If `class` is not provided, the response will not include any objects.

404.description: Successful query result but no matching objects were found.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the specified collection exists.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description:
Creates a new data object. The object's metadata and schema values are validated before creation.

**Note (batch import)**:
If you plan on importing a large number of objects, using the `/batch/objects` endpoint is significantly more efficient than sending multiple single requests.

**Note (idempotence)**:
This operation (POST) fails if an object with the provided ID already exists. To update an existing object, use the PUT or PATCH methods.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The object to be created.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the collection exists and the object properties are valid.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.description: Removes a data object from Weaviate based on its UUID. This endpoint is deprecated; use DELETE /objects/{className}/{id} instead.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to be deleted.
parameters.name: id

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves a specific data object using its UUID. This endpoint is deprecated; use GET /objects/{className}/{id} instead. Also available via Websocket.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to be retrieved.
parameters.name: id

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

patch.description: Updates a data object using JSON merge patch semantics (RFC 7396). Only the fields provided in the request body are modified. Metadata and schema values are validated. The object's `lastUpdateTime` is updated. This endpoint is deprecated; use PATCH /objects/{className}/{id} instead.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to be patched.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: RFC 7396-style JSON merge patch object containing the fields to update.
parameters.name: body

422.description: The patch object is valid JSON but is unprocessable for other reasons (e.g., invalid schema).

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

put.description: Replaces all properties of a data object based on its UUID. The request body should contain the complete object with the desired new state. Metadata and schema values are validated. The object's `lastUpdateTime` is updated. This endpoint is deprecated; use PUT /objects/{className}/{id} instead.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to be replaced.
parameters.name: id
body
parameters.description: The object definition to replace the existing object with.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the collection exists and the object properties are valid.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

head.description: Verifies the existence of a data object based on its UUID without retrieving the full object. Returns a 204 status code if the object exists and 404 if not. This endpoint is deprecated; use HEAD /objects/{className}/{id} instead.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to check.
parameters.name: id

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves a data object's properties and metadata, specified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`). Supports retrieval via Websocket.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.
Unique UUID of the object to be retrieved.
parameters.name: id

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.description:
Removes a data object from a specific collection (class), identified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`).

**Note on deleting references (legacy format):**
For backward compatibility with older beacon formats (lacking a collection name), deleting a reference requires the beacon in the request to exactly match the stored format. Beacons always use `localhost` as the host, indicating the target is within the same Weaviate instance.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.
Unique UUID of the object to be deleted.
parameters.name: id

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

put.description: Replaces all properties of an existing data object. The object is identified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`). The request body must contain the complete object definition with the new property values.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.
Unique UUID of the object to be replaced.
parameters.name: id
body
parameters.description: The object definition to replace the existing object with.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the collection exists and the object properties are valid.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

patch.description: Updates specific properties of an existing data object using JSON merge patch semantics (RFC 7396). The object is identified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`). Only the fields provided in the request body are modified. Metadata and schema values are validated, and the object's `lastUpdateTime` is updated.

parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.
parameters.name: className

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to be patched.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: RFC 7396-style JSON merge patch object containing the fields to update.
parameters.name: body

422.description: The patch object is valid JSON but is unprocessable for other reasons (e.g., invalid schema).

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

head.description:
Verifies the existence of a specific data object within a collection (class), identified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`), without returning the object itself.

This is faster than a GET request as it avoids retrieving and processing object data. Existence is confirmed by a 204 No Content status code, while non-existence results in a 404 Not Found.

parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.
parameters.name: className

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to check.
parameters.name: id

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous (e.g., invalid UUID format).

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description: Adds a reference to a specific property of a data object. The source object is identified by its UUID (`id`). This endpoint is deprecated; use POST /objects/{className}/{id}/references/{propertyName} instead.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the source object.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.
parameters.name: propertyName
body
parameters.description: The reference to add.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the property exists and is a reference type.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

put.description: Replaces all existing references for a specific property on a data object. The source object is identified by its UUID (`id`). This endpoint is deprecated; use PUT /objects/{className}/{id}/references/{propertyName} instead.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the source object.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.
parameters.name: propertyName
body
parameters.description: The new list of references.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the property exists and is a reference type.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.description: Removes a specific reference from a property of a data object. The source object is identified by its UUID (`id`). The reference to remove is specified in the request body. This endpoint is deprecated; use DELETE /objects/{className}/{id}/references/{propertyName} instead.

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the source object.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.
parameters.name: propertyName
body
parameters.description: The reference to remove.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description: Adds a new reference to a reference property (`propertyName`) on a source data object. The source object is identified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`). The reference to add is specified in the request body.

parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the source object belongs to.
parameters.name: className

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the source object.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.
parameters.name: propertyName
body
parameters.description: The reference to add.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the property exists and is a reference type.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.summary: Add an object reference by class

put.description: Replaces all existing references for a specific reference property (`propertyName`) on a source data object. The source object is identified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`). The new set of references is provided in the request body.

parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the source object belongs to.
parameters.name: className

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the source object.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.
parameters.name: propertyName
body
parameters.description: The new list of references.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the property exists and is a reference type.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.description: Removes a specific reference from a reference property (`propertyName`) of a source data object. The source object is identified by its collection name (`className`) and UUID (`id`). The reference to remove is specified in the request body.

parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the source object belongs to.
parameters.name: className

parameters.description: Unique UUID of the source object.
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Unique name of the reference property of the source object.
parameters.name: propertyName
body
parameters.description: The reference to remove.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the property exists and is a reference type.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.summary: Delete an object reference by class

post.description:
Checks if a data object's structure conforms to the specified collection schema and metadata rules without actually storing the object.

A successful validation returns a 200 OK status code with no body. If validation fails, an error response with details is returned.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The object definition to validate.

200.description: Object is valid according to the schema.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but the object is invalid according to the collection (class) definition.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description:
Registers multiple data objects in a single request for efficiency. Metadata and schema values for each object are validated.

**Note (idempotence)**:
This operation is idempotent based on the object UUIDs provided. If an object with a given UUID already exists, it will be overwritten (similar to a PUT operation for that specific object within the batch).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request body containing the objects to be created.

fields.description: Controls which fields are returned in the response for each object. Default is ALL.

objects.description: Array of objects to be created.

200.description: Request processed successfully. Individual object statuses are provided in the response body.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the collection exists and the object properties are valid.

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.description:
Removes multiple data objects based on a filter specified in the request body.

Deletion occurs based on the filter criteria provided in the `where` clause. There is a configurable limit (default 10,000, set via `QUERY_MAXIMUM_RESULTS`) on how many objects can be deleted in a single batch request to prevent excessive resource usage. Objects are deleted in the order they match the filter. To delete more objects than the limit allows, repeat the request until no more matching objects are found.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The request body containing the match filter and output configuration.

200.description: Request processed successfully. See response body for matching objects and deletion results.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous (e.g., invalid filter).

500.description: An error occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description: Batch create cross-references between collection items in bulk.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A list of references to be batched. The ideal size depends on the used database connector. Please see the documentation of the used connector for help.

200.description: Request Successful. Warning: A successful request does not guarantee that every batched reference was successfully created. Inspect the response body to see which references succeeded and which failed.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous. Ensure the collection exists and the object properties are valid.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

post.description: Executes a single GraphQL query provided in the request body. Use this endpoint for all Weaviate data queries and exploration.

parameters.description: The GraphQL query to execute, including the query string and optional variables.
parameters.name: body

200.description: Query executed successfully. The response body contains the query result.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous.

500.description: An internal server error occurred during query execution. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description: Executes multiple GraphQL queries provided in the request body as an array. Allows performing several queries in a single network request for efficiency.

parameters.description: An array containing multiple GraphQL query objects to execute in batch.
parameters.name: body

200.description: Batch request processed successfully. The response body contains an array of results corresponding to the input queries.

422.description: Request body is well-formed but semantically erroneous.

500.description: An internal server error occurred during batch query execution. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Provides meta-information about the running Weaviate instance, including its version, loaded modules, and network hostname. This information can be useful for monitoring, compatibility checks, or inter-instance communication.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while retrieving meta information. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves the definitions of all collections (classes) currently in the database schema.

parameters.name: consistency
parameters.description: If true, the request is proxied to the cluster leader to ensure strong schema consistency. Default is true.

500.description: An error occurred while retrieving the schema. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description:
Defines and creates a new collection (class) in the schema.

If `AutoSchema` is enabled (not recommended for production), Weaviate might attempt to infer schema from data during import. Manual definition via this endpoint provides explicit control.

parameters.name: objectClass
parameters.description: The definition of the collection (class) to create.

200.description: Collection created successfully and its definition returned.

422.description: Invalid collection definition provided. Check the definition structure and properties.

500.description: An error occurred during collection creation. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieve the definition of a specific collection (class), including its properties, configuration, and vectorizer settings.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) to retrieve.

parameters.name: consistency
parameters.description: If true, the request is proxied to the cluster leader to ensure strong schema consistency. Default is true.

500.description: An error occurred while retrieving the collection definition. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.summary: Delete a collection (and all associated data)
delete.description: Removes a collection definition from the schema. WARNING: This action permanently deletes all data objects stored within the collection.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) to delete.

400.description: Could not delete the collection. See the error response for details.

500.description: An error occurred during collection deletion. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

put.description: Updates the configuration settings of an existing collection (class) based on the provided definition. Note: This operation modifies mutable settings specified in the request body. It does not add properties (use `POST /schema/{className}/properties` for that) or change the collection name.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) to update.

parameters.name: objectClass
parameters.description: The updated collection definition containing the settings to modify.

422.description: Invalid update attempt.

500.description: An error occurred while updating the collection. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.summary: Add a property to a collection
post.description: Adds a new property definition to an existing collection (class) definition.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) to add the property to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The definition of the property to add.

200.description: Property added successfully and its definition returned.

422.description: Invalid property definition provided.

500.description: An error occurred while adding the property. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.summary: Get the shards status of a collection
get.description: Retrieves the status of all shards associated with the specified collection (class). For multi-tenant collections, use the 'tenant' query parameter to retrieve status for a specific tenant's shards.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) whose shards to query.

parameters.name: tenant
parameters.description: The name of the tenant for which to retrieve shard statuses (only applicable for multi-tenant collections).

500.description: An error occurred while retrieving shard statuses. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

put.description: Updates the status of a specific shard within a collection (e.g., sets it to 'READY' or 'READONLY'). This is typically used after resolving an underlying issue (like disk space) that caused a shard to become non-operational. There is also a convenience function in each client to set the status of all shards of a collection.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) containing the shard.

parameters.name: shardName
parameters.description: The name of the shard to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The shard status object containing the desired new status.

422.description: Invalid update attempt

500.description: An error occurred while updating the shard status. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description: Creates one or more new tenants for a specified collection (class). Multi-tenancy must be enabled for the collection via its definition.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the multi-tenant enabled collection (class).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of tenant objects to create.

422.description: Invalid request.

500.description: An error occurred while creating tenants. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

put.description: Updates the activity status (e.g., 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE', etc.) of one or more specified tenants within a collection (class).

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) containing the tenants.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of tenant objects specifying the tenants to update and their desired new status.

422.description: Invalid update request.

500.description: An error occurred while updating tenants. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.description: Deletes one or more specified tenants from a collection (class). WARNING: This action permanently deletes all data associated with the specified tenants.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) from which to delete tenants.

parameters.name: tenants
parameters.description: An array of tenant names to delete.

items.description: Name of a tenant to delete.

422.description: Invalid request.

500.description: An error occurred while deleting tenants. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all tenants currently associated with the specified collection.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) whose tenants to list.

parameters.name: consistency
parameters.description: If true, the request is proxied to the cluster leader to ensure strong schema consistency. Default is true.

422.description: Invalid request.

500.description: An error occurred while listing tenants. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

head.description: Checks for the existence of a specific tenant within the given collection without returning tenant details.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) to check within.

parameters.name: tenantName
parameters.description: The name of the tenant to check for.

parameters.name: consistency
parameters.description: If true, the request is proxied to the cluster leader to ensure strong schema consistency. Default is true.

200.description: The tenant exists in the specified collection.

422.description: Invalid request.

500.description: An error occurred during the check. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves details about a specific tenant within the given collection (class), such as its current activity status.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection (class) containing the tenant.

parameters.name: tenantName
parameters.description: The name of the tenant to retrieve.

parameters.name: consistency
parameters.description: If true, the request is proxied to the cluster leader to ensure strong schema consistency. Default is true.

422.description: Invalid request.

500.description: An error occurred while retrieving the tenant. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description:
Initiates the creation of a backup for specified collections on a designated backend storage.

Notes:
- Backups are compressed using gzip by default.
- Weaviate remains operational during the backup process.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup will be stored (e.g., 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', 'azure').

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Details of the backup request, including the backup ID and collections to include or exclude.

200.description: Backup creation process initiated successfully. Check the status endpoint for progress.

422.description: Invalid backup creation request. Check the request body and backend configuration.

500.description: An internal server error occurred during backup initiation. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: [Coming soon] List all backups in progress not implemented yet.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system to list backups from (e.g., 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', 'azure').

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of backups in progress.

422.description: Invalid request to list backups.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while listing backups. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description:
Checks the status of a specific backup creation process identified by its ID on the specified backend.

Client libraries often provide a 'wait for completion' feature that polls this endpoint automatically. Use this endpoint for manual status checks or if 'wait for completion' is disabled.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', 'azure').

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket/container/volume if the backup is not at the root.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the status of the backup creation process.

404.description: Backup not found on the specified backend with the given ID.

422.description: Invalid request to check backup creation status.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while checking backup status. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

delete.description: Deletes a backup identified by its ID from the specified backend storage.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', 'azure').

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup to delete. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket/container/volume if the backup is not at the root.

422.description: Invalid backup deletion request.

500.description: An internal server error occurred during backup deletion. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

post.description:
Initiates the restoration of collections from a specified backup located on a designated backend.

Requirements:
- Target cluster must have the same number of nodes as the source cluster where the backup was created.
- Collections included in the restore must not already exist on the target cluster.
- Node names must match between the backup and the target cluster.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', 'azure').

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup to restore from. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Details of the restore request, including collections to include or exclude and node mapping if necessary.

200.description: Backup restoration process initiated successfully. Check the status endpoint for progress.

404.description: Backup not found on the specified backend with the given ID.

422.description: Invalid backup restoration request. Check requirements and request body.

500.description: An internal server error occurred during restore initiation. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description:
Checks the status of a specific backup restoration process identified by the backup ID on the specified backend.

Client libraries often provide a 'wait for completion' feature that polls this endpoint automatically. Use this endpoint for manual status checks or if 'wait for completion' is disabled.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', 'azure').

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup being restored. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the status of the backup restoration process.

404.description: Backup not found on the specified backend with the given ID.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while checking restore status. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Provides statistics about the internal Raft consensus protocol state for the Weaviate cluster.

422.description: Invalid request for cluster statistics.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while retrieving cluster statistics. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves status information about all nodes in the cluster. Use the 'output' query parameter to control the level of detail.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the status for all nodes.

422.description: Invalid request for node status.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while retrieving node status. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves status information only for the nodes that host shards for the specified collection (`className`). Use the 'output' query parameter to control the level of detail.

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: The name of the collection for which to retrieve node status.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the status for nodes relevant to the specified collection.

422.description: Invalid request for node status.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while retrieving node status for the collection. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.summary: Lists all distributed tasks in the cluster.

500.description: An error has occurred while trying to fulfill the request. Most likely the ErrorResponse will contain more information about the error.

post.description: Initiates a background classification task based on the provided parameters. Use the GET /classifications/{id} endpoint to monitor the status and retrieve results.

parameters.description: Configuration parameters for the classification task, including type, target properties, and training data references.
parameters.name: params

201.description: Classification task successfully initiated. The response body contains the classification details including its ID.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while starting the classification task. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

get.description: Retrieves the status, metadata, and results (if completed) of a classification task identified by its unique ID.

parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the classification task.
parameters.name: id

404.description: Classification with the given ID not found.

500.description: An internal server error occurred while retrieving the classification status. Check the ErrorResponse for details.

tags.name: objects
tags.description: Operations for managing individual data objects. Objects are the primary units of data stored within Weaviate collections. Each object conforms to the data schema definition of its parent collection, containing specific properties (data fields). Objects have one or multiple associated vector embeddings and can link to other objects via cross-references. These endpoints allow you to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on individual data objects.

tags.name: batch
tags.description: Operations for performing actions on multiple data items (objects or references) in a single API request. Batch operations significantly improve performance and efficiency, especially for bulk data imports or large-scale deletions, by reducing network overhead compared to sending individual requests. These endpoints allow for creating multiple objects or deleting objects based on filters.

tags.name: schema
tags.description: Operations related to managing collections. In Weaviate, 'collections' (formerly called 'classes') store your data objects. Each collection has a definition that specifies its data structure (properties and their data types), vectorizer settings (how vectors are generated or managed), and indexing configuration (how data is indexed for efficient search). These endpoints allow you to create, retrieve, update, and delete collection definitions. For detailed usage and code examples on interacting with collections, see the documentation: [https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate/manage-data/collections](https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate/manage-data/collections).

tags.name: backups
tags.description: Operations related to creating and managing backups of Weaviate data. This feature allows you to create snapshots of your collections and store them on external storage backends such as cloud object storage (S3, GCS, Azure) or a shared filesystem. These endpoints enable you to initiate backup and restore processes, monitor their status, list available backups on a backend, and delete unwanted backups. Backups are essential for disaster recovery, data migration, and maintaining point-in-time copies of your vector database.

tags.name: replication
tags.description: Operations related to managing data replication, including initiating and monitoring shard replica movements between nodes, querying current sharding states, and managing the lifecycle of replication tasks.
